title: 108_hr3767
content: The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 introduces Medicare operated prescription drug plans with nationwide coverage. The Secretary will negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers to lower drug costs for eligible individuals, promoting the use of more affordable alternatives when medically appropriate. Strategies to reduce drug prices will be implemented, similar to those used by other federal purchasers. The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 introduces Medicare operated prescription drug plans with nationwide coverage. The Secretary will negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers to lower drug costs for eligible individuals, promoting the use of more affordable alternatives when medically appropriate. Strategies to reduce drug prices will be implemented, similar to those used by other federal purchasers, without overriding medical necessity as determined by the prescribing physician. The monthly beneficiary premium for qualified prescription drug coverage under a Medicare operated prescription drug plan will be uniform nationally. The premium for 2006 is $35, and for succeeding years, it will be based on the average monthly per capita actuarial cost. The Secretary may adjust the premium for supplemental prescription drug coverage. At least one plan in 2006 must have a $35 premium. The Secretary will ensure that at least one Medicare operated prescription drug plan offered in 2006 has a monthly premium of $35. A Medicare operated prescription drug plan shall be offered nationally in addition to any qualifying plans. The Medicare operated prescription drug plan will be offered nationally and shall not be considered as a qualifying or fallback plan for meeting requirements. The Secretary may designate it as the fallback plan for certain service areas. The Secretary may designate the Medicare operated prescription drug plan as the fallback plan for certain service areas, as outlined in various sections of the Act. The text discusses amendments to the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003, specifically regarding the designation of Medicare operated prescription drug plans as fallback plans for certain service areas. The amendments include changes to subparagraphs and definitions within the Act.
